@graph.caption: A stack of orange buns on a wooden work surface

@graph.name: Orange Buns! - Vegan Richa
@graph.description: Zesty and delicious orange buns. These buns are a great way to use up leftover fruit. Use them to make sandwiches or as a snack.

@graph.name: Orange Buns
@graph.description: Zesty and delicious orange buns. These buns are a great way to use up leftover fruit. Use them to make sandwiches or as a snack.
recipeIngredient: 1/2 cups (117ml) orange juice and 1/4 cup (20g) pulp ((pulp is optional))

recipeInstructions.text: Warm the water to just about warm to touch and add sugar and yeast to it. Mix well and let it sit for 10 minutes or until frothy.
recipeInstructions.name: Warm the water to just about warm to touch and add sugar and yeast to it. Mix well and let it sit for 10 minutes or until frothy.

recipeInstructions.text: Grease the mixer bowl and add the flours,bran and salt to it. Mix well.
recipeInstructions.name: Grease the mixer bowl and add the flours,bran and salt to it. Mix well.

recipeInstructions.text: Add in the oil, egg and orange juice and give it a whirl.
recipeInstructions.name: Add in the oil, egg and orange juice and give it a whirl.

recipeInstructions.text: Add in the yeast mixture and run the mixer with dough hook for 10 minutes. ( batches of 3 minutes with intermittent scraping)
recipeInstructions.name: Add in the yeast mixture and run the mixer with dough hook for 10 minutes. ( batches of 3 minutes with intermittent scraping)

recipeInstructions.text: Add in more water or flour if needed. Dough should be soft, not sticky.
recipeInstructions.name: Add in more water or flour if needed. Dough should be soft, not sticky.

recipeInstructions.text: Place dough in well greased container, covered with plastic wrap for an hour or until doubled.
recipeInstructions.name: Place dough in well greased container, covered with plastic wrap for an hour or until doubled.

recipeInstructions.text: Punch it down and using some flour knead dough for a minute to reduce stickiness.
recipeInstructions.name: Punch it down and using some flour knead dough for a minute to reduce stickiness.

recipeInstructions.text: Make 8-10 small balls. Shape balls by pulling on all sides and tucking under.
recipeInstructions.name: Make 8-10 small balls. Shape balls by pulling on all sides and tucking under.

recipeInstructions.text: Place balls on parchment, an inch apart and cover with towel and let rise for half an hour.
recipeInstructions.name: Place balls on parchment, an inch apart and cover with towel and let rise for half an hour.

recipeInstructions.text: Bake at 375 degrees F for 20 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Bake at 375 degrees F for 20 minutes.
